meanings.sent1: The permafrost in the Arctic never thaws, staying frozen all year round.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the permafrost to understand its impact on the environment.
meanings.sent3: The permafrost was so cold, even the polar bears wore extra fur coats!
meanings.sent4: The permafrost held onto the secrets of ancient times, frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: Walking on the permafrost felt like stepping on solid ice forever.

meanings.definition: Permafrost: a layer of soil or rock that remains frozen throughout the year.
meanings.sent1: The permafrost beneath the surface kept the ground solid and icy.
meanings.sent2: In the tundra, the permafrost acts like a frozen barrier beneath the soil.
meanings.sent3: The permafrost was like a giant ice cube keeping the earth chilled.
meanings.sent4: The permafrost was a stubborn layer, refusing to thaw even in summer.
meanings.sent5: The permafrost's icy grip on the land never loosened its hold.
